value.title: Facebook is 'looking at' facial recognition technology for upcoming smart glasses, executive confirms
value.excerpt: Facebook's head of hardware on Thursday confirmed a report that the company is considering facial recognition technology for its upcoming smart glasses devices.

value.title: DBS Offers Facial Recognition For SMB Customers
value.excerpt: Small and medium-sized business (SMB) owners in Singapore will be able to use facial recognition to access their DBS Bank accounts.

value.title: Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels Community Showcase

value.title: Teaneck just banned facial recognition technology for police. Here's why
value.excerpt: Teaneck banned the usage of facial recognition software following widespread criticism of the technology wrongfully targeting people of color.

value.title: Amazon launches computer vision service to detect defects in manufactured products
value.excerpt: Amazon today announced the general availability of Amazon Lookout for Vision, a cloud service that analyzes images using computer vision and AI to spot product or process defects and anomalies in manufactured products.

value.title: Viewpoint: Regulate facial recognition tool, don't outlaw it
value.excerpt: Like any innovation, facial recognition has its risks, but it’s many times better than the alternative. Before cameras often captured crimes in progress, the crucial evidence in many cases came not from video images but from eyewitnesses.

value.title: Russian police use facial recognition or ‘face control’ against protesters
value.excerpt: He was detained on his way there by police using facial recognition technology in the Moscow metro. But reports from other protesters who have attend rallies in recent weeks in support of jailed opposition politician Alexei Navalny also indicate police are using facial recognition technology to make preventive arrests and detentions.

value.title: Bias allegations against facial recognition prompt legal challenge, threat

value.title: Clearview AI Thinks The Solution to Dating Is Facial Recognition

value.title: Minneapolis bans police, government use of facial recognition

value.title: CBP Facial Recognition Scanners Failed to Find a Single Imposter At Airports in 2020
value.excerpt: Customs and Border Protection used facial recognition tools to scan over 23 million travelers’ faces at 30-plus points of entry in 2020, and failed to turn up a single example of an individual impersonating someone else at an airport,
